H0.text: Kidneys are the organs that perform blood filtration through nephrons, renal tubules, and the loop of Henle.

H1.text: The bladder is the organ that performs the process of blood filtration involving nephrons, renal tubules, and the loop of Henle.

H2.text: Lungs are the organs that contain nephrons, renal tubules, and the loop of Henle as part of the blood‑filtration process.

H3.text: Liver is the organ that contains nephrons, renal tubules, and the loop of Henle as part of the blood‑filtration process.

A4.text: Filtration occurs in the glomerulus: one-fifth of the blood volume that enters the kidneys is filtered.

A5.text: The nephron is the structural and functional unit of the kidney.
